title: Working out with your partner is the latest secret to building intimacy : Wellness, News - India Today
text:
Wellness Working out with your partner is the latest secret to building intimacy Delhiites have cracked the code on staying fit and spending enough time with their partners, by working out together. Karishma Kuenzang | Posted By Disha Roy Choudhury A + A - Working out together is cost-effective and also makes couples feel connected. They literally see each other at their worst, which improves the relationship! Photo: Mail Today 
If you and your better half are fitness-savvy and you didn't get a "good enough" gift for her this Valentine's Day, then maybe you could suggest working out together. A trend that's coming up among couples of all ages in the capital, working out together is more like a buddy system, which also gives people with hectic schedules some more time together. 
Take the case of 29-year-old Gurdeep and Tushar, who have started working out together for an hour everyday (except weekends) for the last five months. She says, "We have a one and a half year old baby and I had put on a lot of weight after the pregnancy. I really wanted to join the gym, but that's impossible due to my hectic schedule at work, where I spend all day working on laptops. So, I came up with the idea of working out together in the morning. Before getting married, I was inclined yoga and aerobics, and he used to go the gym. Now, instead of that we do a lot of cardio and yoga together, and he indulges in some weight lifting. We anyway get very little time together, and this not only ensures that we get some time together every morning, but also motivate each other to stay fit!" However, Gurdeep says that dieting is something that she finds impossible, thanks to the fact that she barely gets any time to cook. 
Pointing out how working out together can be beneficial in more ways than one would think, Dr Dharam P Pandey, Director and HOD, department of Physiotherapy & Rehabilitation, BLK Super Speciality Hospital, says, "Not only is it cost-effective and saves money, but people feel more connected to each other, supported and confident, and you also get a lot of additional time together. Also, you literally see each other at your worst, so it also improves your relationship and hence, intimacy." Manmeet, who trains couples at Anytime Fitness opines that it's important for a trainer to know about the bond and the relationship a couple shares,besides knowing their fitness levels, of course. 
Also Watch: 5 basic yoga asanas you can do anytime, anywhere 
"Young people today are opting for a lot of cardio. I usually recommend 20-minute cardio and functional training or body weight exercises to people who come to me. Many also want to do ab exercises and of course, there's the lot which has back issues due to their desk jobs. And it works out pretty well for people because you are working out with someone you're comfortable with." Manmeet, who trains about 10 couples a day, says that most couples have the same body type, and hence, have the same regime. "But sometimes, their body types are different or have injuries of problems, so we have to tweak a few exercises here and there to make it more convenient." She recommends doing crunches with a ball, planks and trunk rotation with a band. Abhishek Sinha, Manager and Head Trainer Equilibrium, Faridabad, recommends abdominal workouts, leg workouts, chest workouts by body weight together, acroyoga workouts, circuit training together, running, cycling, body combat workouts and acrobatics in the swimming pool. 
41-year old Harsh and his wife Aditi (38) have figures out exactly how to tackle their health. He's an interior designer who does a lot of field work and she's a lecturer at Delhi University, and they both make it a point to work out for an hour at least five times a week. Says Harsh, "We are also very conscious about our diet, read up a lot about staying fit and pick up a lot of exercises for couples off the internet. We've divided up the work - she works on the mental part, which is all the studies on the internet on the exercises and the kind of nutrition needed, while I work on physical aspect like which weights to pick up, etc. It helps us train better and keeps us motivated. Though body weight exercises are a little tough, it's easier to work with weights. We do a lot of push ups, pull ups, squats and bench tricep. Our cardio is a little different - we sprint for 30 seconds and then walk for three minutes - the body burns up all the fat directly in those three minutes and 30 seconds." And as far as their diet goes, they eat a lot of natural foods and avoid processed foods. They also eat a lot of bananas, sports supplements like protein shakes, Chicken, eggs and meats in healthy preparations. But Saturday is their cheat day. Adds Harsh, "We don't party every day or hit the gym. We just party on Saturdays, the only cheat day." Sweating out with each other brings intimacy. Photo: Mail Today 
Some exercises you can do at home with BAE 
Sweetheart squat: Couples should stand facing each other and hold their partner's forearms. Make sure you maintain a secure grip as both the partners' squat down and return to the starting position. This exercise will strengthen your legs, besides building a sense of trust between the two. 
Wheelbarrow pushup and squat: The Start with a push-up, and get your better half to hold your feet in their hands. brace your core, and do as many push-ups possible. as you lower yourself, your partner should lower into a squat, keeping his or her arms straight. repeat this 10 times in each position, and then switch places. 
Lovers' toss: Both people should sit down facing each other with their knees bent and toes touching. One should hold a medicine ball into the chest. Keeping the spine straight and sitting up make one feel the abs engage. Hold that position and play catch with the ball. 
Partner running accompanied by tubing: Loop a resistance tubing or band around the hips of your partner. Walk backwards until there's tension on the tubing, and hold it in place while your partner runs in place for few seconds. Partners can take turns and switch sides after every round. 
Dynamic lunge: Stand an arm's length away from your partner whilst facing him/her. Hold each other's hands. Lunge forward with your right leg as your partner lunges backward with their left leg. Now lunge backward with your right leg as your partner lunges forward with their left. Do this five times, then switch sides.
